HOP.NAME: Galena
HOP.NOTES: Used for: General bittering hops for all beers Aroma: Strong, clean, balanced bittering Substitutes: Eroica, Northern Brewer, Cluster, Chinook Examples: Catamount Porter

HOP.NAME: Cascade
HOP.NOTES: A hops with Northern Brewers Heritage Used for: American ales and lagers Aroma: Strong spicy, floral, grapefruit character Substitutes: Centennial Examples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Liberty Ale

HOP.NAME: Cascade
HOP.NOTES: A hops with Northern Brewers Heritage Used for: American ales and lagers Aroma: Strong spicy, floral, grapefruit character Substitutes: Centennial Examples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Liberty Ale

HOP.NAME: Columbus (Tomahawk)
HOP.NOTES: Engineered Centennial Substitute - High alpha bittering hops. Used for: Bittering, flavor, aroma - IPA, American Pale Ale, Stout, Lager Aroma: Pungent, spicy. Strongly aromatic, but clean tasting bitterness Substitutes: Centennial

HOP.NAME: Cascade
HOP.NOTES: A hops with Northern Brewers Heritage Used for: American ales and lagers Aroma: Strong spicy, floral, grapefruit character Substitutes: Centennial Examples: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Liberty Ale

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) Bel
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles Higher potential yield than US, English equivalent pale ale malts

FERMENTABLE.NAME: White Wheat Malt
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: White wheat gives a malty flavor not available from raw wheat. Used in Weiss, Wit and White beers

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Cara-Pils/Dextrine
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer. Also sold under the names "Dextrine" and "Cara-Foam"

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 10L
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, color and improves head retention. Also called "Crystal" malt.

YEAST.NAME: German Ale/Kolsch
YEAST.NOTES: Great for light beers. Accentuates hop flavors. Slight sulfer flavor will fade with age and leave a clean, lager like ale.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Kolsch, Altbiers, Pale Ales, Blonde and Honey Ales

STYLE.NAME: Blonde Ale
STYLE.NOTES: Easy-drinking, approachable, malt-oriented American craft beer, often with interesting fruit, hop, or character malt notes. Well-balanced and clean, is a refreshing pint without aggressive flavors. History: An American craft beer style produced by many microbreweries and brewpubs, particularly those who cannot produce lagers. Regional variations exist (many US West Coast brewpub examples are more assertive, like pale ales) but in most areas this beer is designed as the least challenging beer in their lineup. Style Comparison: Typically has more flavor than American Lagers and Cream Ales. Less bitterness than an American Pale Ale.
STYLE.PROFILE: Aroma: Light to moderate sweet malty aroma, possibly with a light bready or caramelly note. Low to moderate fruitiness is optional, but acceptable. May have a low to medium hop aroma, and can reflect almost any hop variety although citrusy, floral, fruity, and spicy notes are common. Appearance: Light yellow to deep gold in color. Clear to brilliant. Low to medium white head with fair to good retention. Flavor: Initial soft malty sweetness, but optionally some light character malt flavor (e.g., bread, toast, biscuit, wheat) can also be present. Caramel flavors typically absent; if present, they are typically low-color caramel notes. Low to medium fruity esters optional, but are welcome. Light to moderate hop flavor (any variety), but shouldn’t be overly aggressive. Medium-low to medium bitterness, but the balance is normally towards the malt or even between malt and hops. Finishes medium-dry to slightly malty-sweet; impression of sweetness is often an expression of lower bitterness than actual residual sweetness. Mouthfeel: Medium-light to medium body. Medium to high carbonation. Smooth without being heavy. Comments: Brewpub alternative to standard American lagers, typically offered as an entry-level craft beer.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Generally all malt, but can include up to 25% wheat malt and some sugar adjuncts. Any hop variety can be used. Clean American, lightly fruity English, or Kölsch yeast. May also be made with lager yeast, or cold-conditioned. Some versions may have honey, spices and/or fruit added, although if any of these ingredients are stronger than a background flavor they should be entered in those specialty categories instead.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale, Pelican Kiwanda Cream Ale, Russian River Aud Blonde, Victory Summer Love, Widmer Citra Summer Blonde Brew

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Light Body, No Mash Out
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 19.56 l of water at 74.2 C
